alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 1:10PM CST until January 26 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Louisiana, including the following parish, Calcasieu and southeast Texas, including the following counties, Jasper, Newton and Orange. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 PM CST, gauge reports indicated water levels remain high due to heavy rain from thunderstorms.. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaumont, Orange, Nederland, Port Neches, Vidor, Bridge City, West Orange, Mauriceville, Deweyville, Buna, Rose City, Pine Forest, Gist, Hartburg, Forest Heights, Wrights Settlement, Devils Pocket, Pinehurst and Orangefield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
